questions.question: How do I create text in a document?
questions.answer: Call `editor.createText("...")` to get a new standalone `TextNode`.

questions.question: Where is the actual string stored?
How can I edit existing text content?
questions.answer: Use `replaceText()` for range replacement, `insertText()` for insertion at position, `appendText()` for adding to end, and `deleteText()` for range deletion.

questions.question: How do I read or batch-edit character styles?
questions.answer: Use the `characterStyleRanges` array to get or set ranges.

questions.question: How do I change a font programmatically?
questions.answer: Await `fonts.fromPostscriptName("PSName")` and pass the font to `applyCharacterStyles`.

questions.question: Why must font edits be queued?
questions.answer: Because `fromPostscriptName()` is async; wrap the style edit in `editor.queueAsyncEdit()`.

questions.question: How do I apply paragraph-level formatting?
Where can I inspect paragraph formats?
What happens to styles after replacing text?
questions.answer: They reset; save style ranges first and reassign them afterward to preserve formatting. This is a temporary limitation until automatic preservation of paragraph styles is implemented.

questions.question: Can I create a threaded text frame with createText()?
questions.answer: No, it only returns `StandaloneTextNode`; threaded nodes aren't creatable yet.

questions.question: How do I find all frames sharing the same story?
How do I add or remove hyperlinks from text?
questions.answer: Use `applyCharacterStyles()` with a `link` property. Set to a URL string to add a hyperlink, or to an empty string to remove it.

questions.question: How do I handle premium fonts and font availability?
questions.answer: Check `font.isPremium` and `font.availableForEditing` properties. Use `hasUnavailableFonts()` to detect issues. Premium fonts require user subscription; unavailable fonts prevent text modification until replaced with available fonts.

questions.question: What's the difference between `replaceText()` and setting `fullContent.text`?
questions.answer: `replaceText()` preserves existing styles and allows you to control styling of the replacement text, while setting `fullContent.text` (not recommended) resets all style ranges to default.

questions.question: How do I insert text while preserving existing styles?
questions.answer: Use `insertText()` with a `TextStyleSource` constant like `constants.TextStyleSource.beforeInsertionPoint` to inherit styles from surrounding text.

questions.question: What happens if I try to modify text with unavailable fonts?
questions.answer: The operation may throw an error. Use `hasUnavailableFonts()` to check first, and consider changing fonts to available ones before modifying text.

questions.question: Can I specify custom styles when using text replacement APIs?
questions.answer: Yes, all text replacement methods (`replaceText()`, `insertText()`) accept an optional style parameter where you can provide `CharacterStylesInput` or use `TextStyleSource` constants.
